data.name: Issue 16
data.value: 第16期

data.name: Spring 2021
data.value: 2021年春季刊

data.name: How your gifts can transform live in shangai
data.value: 您的捐赠如何改变了人们在上海的生活

data.name: Re:news
data.value: 日新新闻

data.name: A story of desperation and hope
data.value: 一个从绝望到希望的故事

data.name: Author profile
data.value: 作者简介

data.name: By Hanson Ye
data.value: 作者：叶海生，项目运营总监

data.name: By Jack Niu, Renewal Center Volunteer
data.value: 作者：日新中心志愿者钮嘉昆

data.name: As well as a holiday meal, each guest received a party favor of seasonal mandarins, peanuts, a drink and a few renminbi to spend on essentials.
data.value: 除了节日餐之外，每位来访者还得到了活动的临别赠礼，包括时令的柑橘、花生、饮料和少量现金，用以购买生活必需品。

data.name: Despite everything Tao tries to stay positive. He hopes the economic impact of the pandemic will soon be a distant memory so society will turn to normal and he can find a decent job. In the meantime, Tao says he’s very grateful to you for the help he needs to survive.
data.value: 尽管如此，陶德正依然保持乐观。他希望疫情造成的经济影响将很快过去，社会能够恢复正轨，而他自己可以找到一份体面的工作。同时，陶德正非常感激您对他提供的帮助，这为他继续生活下去带来了希望。

data.name: During the national holiday last month, several of our graduates returned to the Renewal Center because they consider it their home. Zhou Yushuai told us he has made some good friends at his factory job in Ningbo. One of our other guys reminded us of the importance of family, saying, “Every holiday, it’s loved ones I miss the most.”
data.value: 在上个月的国庆假期期间，多名日新中心培训计划的毕业生回到了中心，因为这里仍是他们的家。周余帅告诉我们，他在宁波工厂的新工作中已经结识了多位好友。正像他们中的另一位强调的，“每逢佳节倍思亲！”而我们就是相互间最重要的亲人。

data.name: Hanson Ye and Jimmy McWhinney
data.value: 叶海生和Jimmy McWhinney

data.name: Luo Yu could tell you all about it. He was doing exceptionally well in our residential program and ready to start training one day a week at one of our outstanding partner restaurants, M on the Bund – when he suddenly disappeared.
data.value: 罗玉可以告诉您关于这一切的故事。当时他在我们的住宿项目中表现优异，正准备参加我们的一个合作伙伴——米氏西餐厅每周一次的培训，然后，他突然失踪了。

data.name: His only escape from the cold
data.value: 他躲避严寒的唯一希望

data.name: Were you ever given a second chance in life? What about a third chance? Each one of us has experienced failure at some point, but then there’s the kind of personal crisis that happens right on the verge of success...
data.value: 您在人生中曾否有过第二次机会，甚或第三次机会呢？我们每个人在某个时刻都经历过失败，功败垂成之际，也陷入了人生危机……

data.name: That was a year ago. It was sad but understandable – because we know that even small steps toward full-time employment can be intimidating for those who know the joy of total freedom, even if it comes with the pain of homelessness.
data.value: 那是一年前的事了，虽然令人难过却可以理解——因为我们知道，对于那些享受过自由自在的乐趣的人来说，即使是向全职工作迈出一小步，也让他们战战兢兢，即便自由伴随着无家可归的痛苦。

data.name: You were there when he needed a second chance
data.value: 因为您，他的人生有了第二次机会

data.name: Luo Yu dropped out of job training a year ago, but we’re glad to welcome him back
data.value: 罗玉一年前中断了就业培训项目，但我们很高兴他能回来

data.name: No one has any doubt that Luo Yu will land a satisfying job when he completes the Renewal Center’s training program.
data.value: 在完成日新中心的培训项目后，罗玉一定能找到一份满意的工作，对此人人都深信不疑。

data.name: I just want a stable well-paid job. I’ve been drifting for too long.
data.value: 我只想要一份稳定且收入不错的工作，我已经漂泊了太久。

data.name: But ... now Luo Yu is back! And far from getting the cold shoulder from his former friends, we’re still ready to help him make a new start. Every part of our journey brings us to where we are, and for Luo Yu, it’s your support that says, “Yes, come back, you wanderer!”
data.value: 但是……现在罗玉又回来了！老朋友们并不会对他冷眼相待，我们仍然准备帮助他重新开始。人生旅程中的各个部分让我们最终来到了这里，对于罗玉来说，正是您的支持告诉他：“对，回来吧，漂泊的人！”

data.name: It happened to Yan Shipin, 45. He drops into the Renewal Center for the occasional hot meal, but also relies on the showers and clothing exchange to stay presentable enough to look for a job. In the meantime, he sleeps in the airport for safety and warmth – and because there’s less of a chance he’ll be told to move on.
data.value: 这个人就是45岁的颜士平。他偶尔会来到日新中心接受我们提供的午餐，但对他而言最重要的是淋浴和换洗衣服的服务，因为那可以使他重获找工作的自信。同时，他晚上都在虹桥机场过夜，因为那里比较安全和温暖，而且那里很少会有人赶他离开。

data.name: Our Spring Festival meal includes traditional dumplings, or jiaozi, all handmade by volunteers.
data.value: 我们的春节餐包括由志愿者们亲手包的饺子。

data.name: People come for a hot meal and learn about our job training program
data.value: 从享用一份热饭开始，人们了解了我们的就业培训项目

data.name: My gift for meals and training
data.value: 我愿为提供温暖的饭菜和培训而捐款

data.name: Thank you! Your support provided a hot holiday meal to 100 homeless guests and introduced them to our job training program. And because family reunions such a big tradition at this time of year, your gifts help overcome the sadness of having no family or being unable or afraid to return home. Your kindness also gave a few renminbi in a traditional red envelope to guests who could not otherwise afford their next meal because there’s no short-term work over the holiday.
data.value: 感谢您！您的帮助为100位无家可归的来访者提供了热腾腾的节日餐，并让他们了解了我们的就业培训项目。根据传统，每年的这个时候都是合家团圆的时刻，您的捐助帮助他们战胜了无家可归、无法回家或害怕回家的痛苦。您的善意还赠与了来访者们传统的春节红包，使他们在无工可打的春节期间的生活也能得以维系。

data.name: Tao Dezheng had no choice but to leave his family and search for work
data.value: 陶德正不得不离开家人去寻找工作

data.name: That man sleeping alone in the airport concourse – is he waiting for a flight? You might be surprised to find that not only does he not have a ticket, he doesn’t have a passport, a wallet or even a few coins buy his next meal.
data.value: 有个人正独自睡在机场大厅——他是在等候他的航班吗？了解真相后你会惊奇地发现，他不但没有机票、没有护照、没有钱包，甚至连买下一顿饭所需的几枚硬币都没有。

data.name: The good news for Zhang and many others is your amazing support. Your gifts are a lifeline to people who have no other help to meet their basic needs, so we and the people you reach every day are deeply grateful for you and the gifts you give. We are also very aware how much we depend on your financial generosity – and donations like clean, wearable, used or new clothes – to give people a better chance of finding work and making a new start in life.
data.value: 您的支持对张明和许多其他人而言就是最好的消息。对于那些生活的基本需求都无法得到满足的人们而言，您的捐赠能够拯救他们的生命，我们和这些受助者们都对您怀有衷心的感激。我们也清楚地知道，您慷慨的资金捐赠，以及捐助的各种干净、实用的衣物，是我们得以帮助无家可归者找到工作，进而开始新生的最大依靠。

data.name: The Renewal Center gives Yan Shipin, 45, the confidence to look for a job.
data.value: 日新中心使45岁的颜士平重新具备了找工作的信心

data.name: Like anyone who succeeds in our very challenging program, Luo Yu is an extremely hard worker who is once again learning to apply his effort do doing tasks according to plan, not just the way he thinks best. And he says he’s ready this time to finish the work he started, “I just want a stable, well-paid job. I’ve been drifting for too long.”
data.value: 就像成功完成这个充满挑战的项目的其它人一样，罗玉是一个非常努力的人，他再次学会了按计划完成任务，而不是按照他自认为最佳的方式。他说这次他准备好了要完成之前开始的工作：“我只想要一份稳定且收入不错的工作，我已经漂泊太久了。”

data.name: The Renewal Center’s training program is often the key to successful life-change, and is open to anyone who is willing to put in serious work towards finding full-time employment.
data.value: 日新中心的培训项目通常是成功改变生活的关键，任何有意愿努力寻求一份全职工作的人都可参加。

data.name: Because we serve meals every day, can you help provide more essential food this spring? It will definitely attract more people into our training program.
data.value: 由于每天都需要供应食物，您是否可以在今年春天支持我们提供更多的食物？这样一定能吸引到更多的人参加我们的培训项目。

data.name: Yan used to be a part-time attendant in the public baths, but since they closed, he now scrapes together whatever money he can collecting plastic bottles to recycle. Your kindness makes a difference to him – and will have a life-changing impact on the next person in need. As Yan says, “The clean clothes I receive at the Renewal Center give me the dignity to ride on public transport and interview for jobs.”
data.value: 颜士平曾经在公共浴室做过临时工。但现在浴室关门了，他只能依靠捡塑料瓶换取一点点收入。您的慷慨捐赠帮助了他——也将对下一位需要帮助的无家可归者产生改变人生的影响。正如颜士平所说：“日新中心为我提供的干净衣服使我有了自信，也让我敢去坐公交地铁和找工作了。”

data.name: You can help the homeless hiding in plain sight
data.value: 您的资助给无家可归者带来了自信

data.name: Your gift will help the homeless hit by Covid-19.
data.value: 您的捐赠能够帮助受新冠影响的无家可归者。

data.name: A hot meal and shower costs 15 RMB ($2.30). Add a day’s job training for a total of 60 RMB ($9.20).
data.value: 一顿温暖的饭菜和和一次淋浴的费用是15元人民币，加上一天的职业培训，总计60 元人民币。

data.name: Your gifts mean Tao doesn’t have to beg for food.
data.value: 您的捐赠使陶德正不必再去乞讨食物

data.name: Spring Festival dinner is a launch pad for new lives
data.value: 春节的那顿饭菜是迈向新生活的开始

data.name: Your help has never been so important
data.value: 您此时的帮助对我们而言更加重要

data.name: We spend 60 RMB ($9.20) per person, per day for meals, training and accommodation, including the work our trainees do to keep the Renewal Center working for others. Your help today could change a life!
data.value: 我们每天为每个人花费60元，用于他们餐食、培训和住宿，包括让受训人员参与日新中心的日常运营工作，为他人提供服务。今天您的帮助将会改变人们的一生！

data.name: Because we serve meals every day, can you help provide more essential food this spring? It will definitely attract more people into our training program.
data.value: 由于每天都需要供应食物，您是否可以在今年春天支持我们提供更多的食物？这样一定能吸引到更多的人参加我们的培训项目。

data.name: Chen Wenlin was invited by a friend and said, “I saw so many friends there. It brought me hope.” He was incredibly grateful for the gift of cash. “I don’t know what I would have done without your hongbao.” Better yet, Chen has already started our job training program. He is enthusiastically doing daily chores and learning to read and write, practicing his characters in a notebook used by schoolchildren.
data.value: 陈文林是被朋友邀请来的，他说：“我在那儿见到了很多朋友，这给我带来了希望。”他对红包深表感谢：“如果没有你们的红包，我都不知道该怎么办。”更棒的是，陈文林已经参加了我们的就业培训项目。他对日常家务充满热情，也喜欢学习读书写字，以及在一本小学生作业本上练字。”
